movies.title: Sexual Dependence Day
movies.plot: Ron Slick is a Washington lobbyist who comes by Dr. Fez's "clicker" invention, which makes women errogeneously ex-tra-cited; Slick uses the clicker on a senator, a reporter, a police officer and two federal agents. This entry may be part of the seven episode TV series, released as a full feature.

biography.bio: Kevin E. West hails from Nashville, TN where he grew up from the late 60s through the mid-80s before starting his performing career in Atlanta, GA. He will play any sport with a score and/or ball, as a six-time participant in the Men's Senior Baseball World Series, along with playing deadly serious Texas Hold-em on a part-time basis in the world's toughest card room, Commerce Casino. Kevin has run the LA Marathon 4 times and played collegiate golf at two Universities in his youth. Aside from his long television career Kevin also spent his first two years as a Stand-up Comic and Improv artist in his early days in Hollywood. Not too long into his career in Los Angeles Kevin created The Actors' Network. The Actors' Network the most recognized, trusted, and industry endorsed actor's business organization in the United States. The Actors' Network holds consecutive (2006/2007) Backstage West "Reader's Choice" awards, has been featured on Entertainment Tonight three times, and CNBC twice. It's many successful alumni include Golden Globe & Emmy Nominee Masi Oka (Heroes), and Christopher Gorham (Covert Affairs) of the Golden Globe Award winning cast of Ugly Betty and Maggie Grace (Taken). With wit, warmth and wisdom Kevin has saved many actors from the pitfalls of the often heart wrenching life of the actor in Hollywood. He is widely recognized in the industry as an expert on the business education of the performer speaking at SAG, ShowBiz Expo (NYC), UCLA, SAG Conservatory, Chapman University, Cal State Fullerton, and talent conventions across the US from Dallas to Florida. He was also featured as the Keynote speaker, at a prominent Hollywood education event, held at the Writers Guild of America and continues to speaking nationally and internationally. In early 2014 Kevin created Dirty Laundry TV, "The news program that will give you the runs." In early 2010, to further his desire to educate the acting community worldwide, he created the Industry Professional interview series, ActorBizGuru. He has also shared his expertise with acting community far beyond Hollywood Co-Authoring the 2-hour CD "The Actor's Guide to Getting the Job" with LA's top commercial instructor, Carolyne Barry. Kevin was also responsible for the creation of the annual Hack n' Smack, Kerry Daveline Memorial, Celebrity Golf Tournament in Southern California benefiting Melanoma. The Hack n' Smack event included such celebrities as: Joe Pesci, Joe Mantegna, Ron Perlman and Michael Chiklis. The event was voted one of the top 10 celebrity golf events in Southern California by Southland Golf magazine. He has lent his considerable talents as writer, producer, host and director to numerous charitable events including "Together We Can, Together We Will" in the wake of the L.A. riots, and the teen runaway benefit "Runnin' on Empty" both of which included top Celebrities such as Jason Alexander.
biography.name: Kevin E. West

biography.bio: John La Zar was born and raised in San Francisco, California. He trained at the American Conservatory Theatre and has studied acting with Uta Hagen, Bill Ball, Jack Kosslyn, and Paul Shenar. La Zar was portraying the titular role in a University of Hawaii stage production of "Caligula" when he was approached by 20th Century Fox studio casting agent Phil Benjamin to audition for the part of deranged and debauched rock'n'roll music producer Ronnie 'Z-Man' Barzell in Russ Meyer's delightfully outrageous camp cult classic "Beyond the Valley of the Dolls." John's wonderfully wild and eccentric performance as 'Z-Man' should have led to bigger and better things, but alas did not. A majority of La Zar's subsequent roles have been decidedly minor: funny as sleazy pimp Carl McKinney in Meyer's typically off-the-wall "Supervixens," a Palestine general in the "David & Goliath" episode of "Greatest Heroes of the Bible," a limousine driver in "Eddie Presley," a warlock in "Night of the Scarecrow," and a strip club patron in "Stripteaser." However, on occasion John has landed a more substantial part; he's especially memorable as evil sorcerer Jarek in the enjoyably silly tongue-in-cheek sword and sorcery fantasy hoot "Deathstalker II." La Zar had a recurring role as scientist Dr. Fez on the soft-core cable TV series "Click." In addition to his regrettably sparse film and TV credits, John has acted in stage productions of such plays as "The Crucible," "Macbeth," "Carnival," "High Mass," "No Exit," and "Everyman." Outside of acting, La Zar is also a ballet dancer, master swordsman, and expert martial artist. He lives in Los Angeles, California.
biography.name: John Lazar

biography.bio: Tatiana was born in 1971 in Russia. She is an actress, known for Intimate Stranger (1991), Fantasy 1 (2001) and Fantasy 3 (2001).

biography.bio: Kim Sill was born on December 8, 1963 in Tifton, Georgia, USA as Kimberly Dawn Dawson. She is an actress and producer, known for Sexual Intrigue (2000), Maui Heat (1996) and Carnal Fate (1998).

biography.bio: Ralph Lucas is an actor and writer, known for The Call of Cthulhu (2005), The Child (1977) and Ghost Stories: Graveyard Thriller (1986).

biography.bio: Harrison Young was born on March 13, 1930 in Port Huron, Michigan, USA. He was an actor, known for The Game (1997), Saving Private Ryan (1998) and Bubba Ho-Tep (2002). He died on July 3, 2005.
biography.name: Harrison Young

biography.bio: Laura Palmer was born on September 20, 1969 in the Czech Republic as Petra Simcekova. She is known for her work on The Perils of Ms. Parker (1995), Stripper Wives (1999) and The Exotic House of Wax (1997). She is married to Charlie Sexton.
biography.name: Laura Palmer

biography.bio: Gorgeous and slender honey blonde knockout Holly Hollywood was born Stacey Leigh Mobley on December 2, 1974 in Los Gatos, California. She's of German, Irish, and Native American descent. Holly began her acting career in soft-core movies in the mid 1990's. Hollywood made the leap to explicit hardcore films in her mid 20's in 2000; she started out doing strictly girl/girl scenes, but eventually graduated to boy/girl as well. Among the notable companies Holly appeared in X-rated features for are Vivid, Metro, Evil Angel, Adam & Eve, Legend Video, and Kick Ass Pictures. Hollywood retired from the adult film industry in 2010. The mother of a special needs daughter, Hollywood has done volunteer work for various charities. Moreover, Holly enjoys skydiving and snowboarding.
biography.name: Holly Hollywood
